title: Tutorial
text: SpaCE able decompose cell identities estimate cell-cell interactions tumor spatial transcriptomics data sets.  SpaCE first estimates cancer cell abundance integrating gene pattern dictionary copy number alterations expression changes common malignancies. SpaCE uses constrained regression model calibrate local tissue densities determine stromal immune cell lineage hierarchies. , SpaCE can reveal potential cell-cell interactions tumor microenvironment.

title: Tutorial
text: install SpaCE, recommend using devtools:

title: Tutorial
text: R version >= 4.1.0. R packages: Matrix, jsonlite, png, ggplot2, reshape2, Rjags, psych, ppcor, tidygraph, parallel.

title: Tutorial
code: library(SpaCE) SpaCE_obj <- create.SpaCE.object(platform="Visium",stPath = "./inst/extdata/Visium_BC") SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cancerType="BRCA", coreNo=8)

title: Tutorial
text: Please click visit SpaCE tutorial.

title: Visium
text: read ST data R, user can create SpaCE object create.SpaCE.object. Specifical, user analyzing Visium dataset, need input “visiumPath”. Please make sure “visiumPath” point standard output folders 10x Visium, “filtered_feature_bc_matrix” “spatial” folders. “filtered_feature_bc_matrix”`” folder includes “barcodes.tsv.gz”: spot level barcodes “features.tsv.gz”: list genes “matrix.mtx.gz”: (sparse) matrix counts “spatial” folder includes “tissue_positions_list.csv” : barcodes spatial information “tissue_lowres_image.png” : hematoxylin eosin (H&E) image “scalefactors_json.json” : scaling factors adjusting coordinates , create SpaCE object breast cancer visium dataset.
code: library(SpaCE)  # set the path to the in-house breast cancer ST data. User can set the paths to their own data. visiumPath <- system.file("extdata", 'Visium_BC', package = 'SpaCE')  # load ST data to create an SpaCE object. SpaCE_obj <- create.SpaCE.object(visiumPath = visiumPath)  # show this object. str(SpaCE_obj)

title: Visium
text: creating SpaCE object, user can use SpaCE.visualize.metrics show UMI gene counts across ST spots, respectively.
code: # plot the QC metrics. library(patchwork) p1 <- SpaCE.visualize.metrics(SpaCE_obj, itemQC="UMI") p2 <- SpaCE.visualize.metrics(SpaCE_obj, itemQC="Gene") p1+p2

title: Visium
text: two stages, SpaCE.deconvolution deconvolve mixtures ST spots malignant, immune, stromal cells. SpaCE first estimates malignant cell faction gene pattern dictionary copy number alterations (CNA) expression changes common malignancies. Subsequently, based -house hierarchical cell lineage derived single-cell RNA-seq data sets diverse cancer types, constrained regression model used determine immune stromal cell fraction, also include unidentifiable component calibrate cellular density variations across tissue regions. Specifically, user need specify cancer type tumor ST data set using cancerType parameter, aim select cancer type-specific CNA expression signature infer malignant cell fraction. correlating expression profiles ST spots cancer type-specific signature, set cancer type-specific CNA signature first option chromosomal instability widely considered one consistent feature human tumors. Alternatively, spots strongly correlate CNA signature, cancer type-specific expression signature activated. situation might result chromosomally stable cancer cells low CNA. cancer types included dictionary, created pan-cancer expression signature averaging cancer type-specific expression signatures. built gene pattern dictionary copy number alterations (CNA) expression changes 30 solid tumor types. cancer type-specific CNA signature cancer type computed averaging bulk tumor CNA values gene levels across patients. cancer type, lower quartile patients sorted total CNA burdens excluded calculating CNA signature. cancer type-specific expression signature cancer type generated log2 Fold Change differential expression tumor normal samples. Several cancer types expression signatures due lack adequate normal samples (n < 10 patients). pan-cancer expression signature created averaging cancer type-specific expression signatures.

title: Visium
text: provide SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution show spatial distribution cell type setting parameter cellType.  setting parameter interactive TRUE, user open Shiny plot interactively visualize cell type adjust size alpha intensity spots.
code: # show the spatial distribution of malignant cells and macrophages. p1 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Malignant") p2 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Macrophage") p1+p2 # show the spatial distribution of malignant cells and macrophages. SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Malignant", interactive=TRUE)

title: Visium
text: decomposing cell fractions, SpaCE can infer intercellular interactions based cell colocalization ligand-receptor coexpression. Linear correlations cell fraction cell types computed across ST spots evaluate cell-type colocalization. High positive correlations indicate cell-type pairs tend colocalize together. infer physical interactions, SpaCE tests co-expression ligand receptor genes within ST spot co-localized cell-type pairs.

title: Visium
text: breast tumor tissue, identified several potential colocalized cell-type pairs (see left panel following figure), CAFs endothelial cells M2 macrophages. rule high cell fraction correlation caused similar reference profiles, compared correlations cell-type fractions cell-type reference profiles (see right panel). Although correlation CAF endothelial cell fractions high, profile similarity also proportionally high. However, similarity CAF M2 macrophage references extremely low, indicating CAF-M2 colocalization simply due profile similarity.
code: # calculate the cell-cell colocalization. SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.CCI.colocalization(SpaCE_obj)  # visualize the cell-cell colocalization. SpaCE.visualize.colocalization(SpaCE_obj)

what: Analyze the L-R network enrichement within ST spots
title: Visium
text: Cell colocalization directly indicate physical interaction. Thus, sought evidence cell-cell interactions analyzing ligand-receptor (L-R) interactions within ST spots. previous study, collected approximately 2,500 L-R pairs -house L-R network. ST data set, SpaCE shuffled L-R interaction network using BiRewire package generate 1,000 randomized networks preserving directed degree distributions. spot, L-R network score defined sum expression products L-R pairs, divided average random value 1,000 randomized networks.  L-R network score ST spot indicates overall intensities ligand-receptor interactions location, specific interactions two cell types. Thus, SpaCE performed enrichment analysis L-R network scores cell-type pair. example, colocalization CAF M2 cells breast tumor tissue, SpaCE grouped ST spots four categories: CAF-M2 colocalized, CAF M2 dominated, others (see left middle panels following figure). found CAF-M2 colocalized spots substantial L-R interaction network scores CAF/M2-dominated spots (right panel). results lead prediction CAF-M2 interactions, CAF-Endothelial interactions.
code: # calculate the L-R network score across ST spots. SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.CCI.LRNetworkScore(SpaCE_obj)  # visualize the cell-cell colocalization. SpaCE.visualize.LRNetworkScore(SpaCE_obj) # calculate the L-R network score across ST spots. SpaCE.CCI.cellTypePair(SpaCE_obj,cellTypePair=c("CAF","Macrophage M2"))

title: Tutorial
text: Please click visit SpaCE tutorial.

title: Deconvolution with a matched scRNA-seq data set
text: create SpaCE object, user need prepare three types input data referring tumor ST dataset. spatial transcriptomics count data. spatial transcriptomics count data must format matrix gene name (row) x spot ID (column). spatial location information. spot coordinates format matrix spot ID (row) x coordinates (column). 1st 2nd columns represent X Y coordinates, respectively. path H&E image file. image path can NA unavailable.
code: library(SpaCE)  PDAC_Path <- system.file("extdata", 'oldST_PDAC', package = 'SpaCE') load(paste0(PDAC_Path,"/st_PDAC.rda"))  # show count matrix counts[1:6,1:5]        10x10 10x13 10x14 10x15 10x16 A1CF       0     0     0     0     0 A2M       13     0     4     0     0 A4GALT     1     0     0     0     0 A4GNT      0     0     1     0     0 AAAS       0     0     0     0     0 AACS       0     0     0     0     0  # show coordinate matrix spotCoordinates[1:5,]        X  Y 10x10 10 10 10x13 10 13 10x14 10 14 10x15 10 15 10x16 10 16  # load ST data to create an SpaCE object. SpaCE_obj <- create.SpaCE.object(   counts=counts,   spotCoordinates=spotCoordinates,   imageFile=NA,   platform = "oldST" )  # show this object. str(SpaCE_obj)

title: Deconvolution with a matched scRNA-seq data set
text: provide SpaCE.deconvolution.matched.scRNAseq deconvolve SpaCE object customized scRNA-seq data. User need prepare three types input data referring scRNA-seq dataset. single cell RNA-seq (scRNA-seq) count data. scRNA-seq count data must format matrix gene name (row) x cell ID (column). cell annotation information. matrix include two columns, ,e., cellID cellType. row represents single cell. Hierarchical tree cell types. organized using list, name element major lineages value elements corresponding sublineages. major lineage sublineages, value major lineage . , user can run SpaCE.deconvolution.matched.scRNAseq carry cell type deconvolution.
code: # load sc data PDAC_Path <- system.file("extdata", 'oldST_PDAC', package = 'SpaCE') load(paste0(PDAC_Path,"/sc_PDAC.rda"))  # show count matrix sc_counts[1:6,1:5]         c1 c2 c3 c4 c5 A1BG     0  0  0  0  0 A1CF     0  0  0  1  0 A2M      0  0  0  0  0 A2ML1    0  0  0  0  0 A3GALT2  0  0  0  0  0 A4GALT   0  0  0  0  0  # show cell annotation matrix sc_annotation[1:6,1:5]    cellID bio_celltype                             c1 "c1"   "Acinar cells"                           c2 "c2"   "Ductal - terminal ductal like"          c3 "c3"   "Ductal - terminal ductal like"          c4 "c4"   "Ductal - CRISP3 high/centroacinar like" c5 "c5"   "Cancer clone A"                         c6 "c6"   "Cancer clone A"   # show cell type lineage tree head(sc_lineageTree) $Cancer [1] "Cancer clone A" "Cancer clone B"  $Ductal [1] "Ductal - APOL1 high/hypoxic"            "Ductal - CRISP3 high/centroacinar like" [3] "Ductal - MHC Class II"                  "Ductal - terminal ductal like"           $Macrophage [1] "Macrophages A" "Macrophages B"  $mDC [1] "mDCs A" "mDCs B"  $`Acinar cells` [1] "Acinar cells"  $`Endocrine cells` [1] "Endocrine cells" SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.deconvolution.matched.scRNAseq(   SpaCE_obj,    sc_counts=sc_counts,    sc_annotation=sc_annotation,    sc_lineageTree=sc_lineageTree,    coreNo=8 )  library(patchwork) p1 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Cancer clone A") p2 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Cancer clone B") p3 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Acinar cells") p4 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Ductal - CRISP3 high/centroacinar like") (p1+p2) / (p3+p4)

title: Deconvolution with a matched scRNA-seq data set
text: Although tutorials focus analyzing ST data tumor samples, principle, SpaCE can applied ST datasets matched scRNA-seq data.

SpaCE first estimates malignant cell faction gene pattern dictionary copy number alterations (CNA) expression changes common malignancies. Subsequently, based -house hierarchical cell lineage derived single-cell RNA-seq data sets diverse cancer types, constrained regression model used determine immune stromal cell fraction, also include unidentifiable component calibrate cellular density variations across tissue regions. Specifically, user need specify cancer type tumor ST data set using cancerType parameter, aim select cancer type-specific CNA expression signature infer malignant cell fraction. correlating expression profiles ST spots cancer type-specific signature, set cancer type-specific CNA signature first option chromosomal instability widely considered one consistent feature human tumors. what: Analyze the L-R network enrichment within ST spots
title: Cell type deconvolution and interaction analysis without reference
text: Cell colocalization directly indicate physical interaction. Thus, sought evidence cell-cell interactions analyzing ligand-receptor (L-R) interactions within ST spots. previous study, collected approximately 2,500 L-R pairs -house L-R network. ST data set, SpaCE shuffled L-R interaction network using BiRewire package generate 1,000 randomized networks preserving directed degree distributions. spot, L-R network score defined sum expression products L-R pairs, divided average random value 1,000 randomized networks.  L-R network score ST spot indicates overall intensities ligand-receptor interactions location, specific interactions two cell types. Thus, SpaCE performed enrichment analysis L-R network scores cell-type pair. example, colocalization CAF M2 cells breast tumor tissue, SpaCE grouped ST spots four categories: CAF-M2 colocalized, CAF M2 dominated, others (see left middle panels following figure). found CAF-M2 colocalized spots substantial L-R interaction network scores CAF/M2-dominated spots (right panel). results lead prediction CAF-M2 interactions, CAF-Endothelial interactions.
code: # calculate the L-R network score across ST spots. SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.CCI.LRNetworkScore(SpaCE_obj)  # visualize the cell-cell colocalization. SpaCE.visualize.LRNetworkScore(SpaCE_obj) # calculate the L-R network score across ST spots. SpaCE.CCI.cellTypePair(SpaCE_obj,cellTypePair=c("CAF","Macrophage M2"))

title: Cell type deconvolution and interaction analysis without reference
text: gene expression profiles tumor cells (.e., cancer cell states) determined tumor cells’ genetic background cell-cell interactions surrounding environment. explorative extension, SpaCE can automatically explore spatial distribution different cancer cell states. Based deconvolution results breast cancer dataset, selected ST spots high fractions (> 0.7) malignant cells tumor spots. , SpaCE hierarchically clustered malignant spots infer different states. Silhouette value, measuring similarity among ST spots within cluster compared clusters, used select optimal cluster number.
code: # further deconvolve malignant cell states SpaCE_obj <- SpaCE.deconvolution.malignant(SpaCE_obj)  p1 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Malignant") p2 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Cancer cell state A") p3 <- SpaCE.visualize.deconvolution(SpaCE_obj, cellType="Cancer cell state B") p1+p2+p3

code: @Manual{,   title = {SpaCE: Spatial Cellular Estimator},   author = {Beibei Ru and Peng Jiang},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://github.com/data2intelligence/SpaCE}, }

title: Spatial Cellular Estimator
text: SpaCE can analyze cancer spatial transcriptomics (ST) datasets decompose cell identities estimate cell-cell interactions tumor microenvironment. Briefly, SpaCE first estimates cancer cell abundance integrating gene pattern dictionary common malignancies. SpaCE uses constrained regression model calibrate local tissue densities determine stromal immune cell lineage hierarchies. , SpaCE can reveal putative cell-cell interactions tumor microenvironment. addition, although SpaCE require input cell reference profile process tumor ST data, SpaCE can still accept matched scRNA-seq data customized reference carry cell type deconvolution.

title: Spatial Cellular Estimator
text: install SpaCE, recommend using devtools:

title: Spatial Cellular Estimator
text: R version >= 4.1.0. R packages: Matrix, jsonlite, ggplot2, reshape2, png, jpeg, shiny, MUDAN, factoextra, NbClust, cluster, parallel, psych, BiRewire, limma.

text: SpaCE_obj SpaCE object. itemQC Item quality control metrics..e., "UMI" "gene". colors Legend color scale, Default: c("blue", "yellow", "red").

title: Create an SpaCE object — create.SpaCE.object
text: Read ST dataset create SpaCE object.

title: Create an SpaCE object — create.SpaCE.object
code: create.SpaCE.object(   counts,   spotCoordinates,   imageFile,   platform = c("Visium", "oldST", "Slide-Seq"),   visiumPath = NULL )

title: Create an SpaCE object — create.SpaCE.object
text: counts Count matrix gene name (row) x spot ID (column) spotCoordinates Spot coordinate matrix coordinates (row) x spot ID (column). matrix include two rows, ,e., X Y coordinates, respectively, represent position spots H&E image. imageFile Path H&E image file. Can "NA" available. platform character string indicating platform, .e., "Visium", "oldST", "Slide-Seq". visiumPath Path visium output folder. See ‘Details’ information.

title: Create an SpaCE object — create.SpaCE.object
text: SpaCE object

title: Create an SpaCE object — create.SpaCE.object
text: create SpaCE object, user need input four parameters, .e., "counts", "spotCoordinates", "imageFile", "platform". However, user analyzing Visium data, need input "visiumPath". Please make sure "visiumPath" point standard output folders 10x Visium, `filtered_feature_bc_matrix` `spatial` folders. "filtered_feature_bc_matrix" folder includes  "barcodes.tsv.gz": spot level barcodes;  "features.tsv.gz": list genes;  "matrix.mtx.gz": (sparse) matrix counts. "spatial" folder includes  “tissue_positions_list.csv” : barcodes spatial information;  “tissue_lowres_image.png” : hematoxylin eosin (H&E) image;  “scalefactors_json.json” : scaling factors adjusting coordinates .

title: SpaCE 1.0.0.
text: Release SpaCE package.
